content:
Hey everyone! you may have seen my name pop up here and there, and in any case I just want to formally introduce myself to the community.

I love Rust because of how easy it is to build things. Right now I am focused on doing what I can to improve the compiler's performance, as I think that improvements there will have an impact on increasing widespread adoption. In general I look for issues that affect compile times and try to work on them.

Right now I am focused on improving the documentation around parallel rustc and hope to eventually help make parallel compilation the default.
Is parallel compilation still being worked in?
The WG is not active right now, no
But I think there are talks about that changing right now..
I just opened a PR to see if using a sharded symbol interner improves performance for parallel rustc.

Hello fellow Rustaceans ! Just saying a quick :wave: to everyone . I am complete beginner with some prior knowledge in python .Today is Day1 . Installed Rust in wsl. I have chosen to start by reading "the book" in the "Learn" section. Any pointers or advice?

Hey, welcome :crab:! The book is a great place to start, but remember you need to be putting what you learn into practice as well :+1: For this, I definitely recommend Rustlings for bite-sized exercises, and Exercism for more mentor-guided practice.

Although the tutorial section isn't the greatest, I made a Notion workshop about Rust for my university last year, it might be interesting to check out :smiley: (more importantly, there is a large section at the bottom with a lot of different resources :100:)

https://www.notion.so/CCSS-Devclub-Rust-Workshop-dccad2c1119d4af7bf78f3d3b4797603
I second exercism.io, it's really great. I'd suggest using rust-analyzer instead of the official extension, but beware, it doesn't work well with the rustlings code structure.
java dev by force here... figured I would join the comms for more info. currently going through the book, rustlings, and whatever else I can get my eyes on.
hello!

Hi everyone! I'm a PhD student, currently working on visualizing Rust ownership and other static information. I've been casually using Rust for a few years, but this is my first time seriously trying to study it, and fiddle with the compiler. So I figured I should join and say hi! :big_smile:

Kasra said:

Hi everyone! I'm a PhD student, currently working on visualizing Rust ownership and other static information. I've been casually using Rust for a few years, but this is my first time seriously trying to study it, and fiddle with the compiler. So I figured I should join and say hi! :big_smile:

That sounds cool! Would you mind sharing at which institute you're doing your PhD?
I'm a MSc. student, looking for PhD positions, and would love to do something with Rust.

Hello! I am a total noob to Rustc dev looking to make a single PR for a feature I really want (but don't necessarily need) and skedaddle. Don't really know what else to say than that. I like talking about Rust and other things and heling eole to use Rust when my p key is working.
hey @Jared Landers! thanks for contributing :) feel free to ask in #t-compiler/help if you need help with your PR
rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/ is a good place to start
Thanks!

Jared Landers said:

Hello! I am a total noob to Rustc dev looking to make a single PR for a feature I really want (but don't necessarily need) and skedaddle. Don't really know what else to say than that. I like talking about Rust and other things and heling eole to use Rust when my p key is working.

What's the feature you're looking for?
Hello, brother. Our new server has time to play. Module: RUSTORIA.CO-3X NO BPS [ Ol ]

Hey everybody! We're a small team from Eastern Europe and Rust is new for us so we're looking to hire a senior Rust dev from the same area to join us bud didn't find here any #hire or #job or similar channel to post our JB so I was wondering where would you guys post your Rust JB to find a dev to hire? Is there maybe any Rust job board or another chat somewhere?
@Kaspar L. Palgi This Week in Rust has a jobs section, you can post PRs to add to that. Reddit also has a place to post jobs here.
Thanks @Eric Huss posted to Reddit but didn't really figure out how to post to the "This Week in Rust.
hello! im new to here, and im a college student now.hopefully one day i can do contribute to this community!
@Kaspar L. Palgi "Tweet us at @ThisWeekInRust to get your job offers listed here!"
hello! im 40, male from NL, trying to learn Rust for fun and work both :)

Alex Keizer said:

Kasra said:

Hi everyone! I'm a PhD student, currently working on visualizing Rust ownership and other static information. I've been casually using Rust for a few years, but this is my first time seriously trying to study it, and fiddle with the compiler. So I figured I should join and say hi! :big_smile:

That sounds cool! Would you mind sharing at which institute you're doing your PhD?
I'm a MSc. student, looking for PhD positions, and would love to do something with Rust.

Sure! I'm at UC San Diego, though my group isn't super Rust-specific. We work on programming tools (especially Live Programming and Program Synthesis) generally. I've just been looking for an excuse to work with Rust :upside_down:
